frame

Class GameGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • frame.GameGraphics

  • public class GameGraphics
extends java.lang.Object
    GameGraphics merges all the maps used into the game into one location, which allows interaction to be done between the player and the terrain. It provides rendering capabilities for both movement and battle game-play, by storing information about both.

    Changes: The class now supports all aspects of combat, all three inventories, and victory conditions.

    Total Time Spent: 10 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public java.lang.String move(java.awt.Point dir)
        Attempts to move the player, and returns the resulting message.
        Parameters:
        dir - a point to represent the direction of movement, with dir.x being the change in x, and dir.y being the change in y.
        Returns:
        The message of the tile that the player moved into, or "" if combat needs to take place.

      • doorMove

        private java.lang.String doorMove(java.awt.Point dir)
        Movement through a door, which requires a change of map rather than position.
        Parameters:
        dir - a point to represent the direction of movement, with dir.x being the change in x, and dir.y being the change in y.
        Returns:
        String represented by null, used for the return of the message from move(Point).

      • getMap

        public java.awt.Image getMap()
        This method allows the current map to be displayed. It takes into account the visibility available to the player.
        Returns:
        An image representing the current map, with invisible tiles being black.

      • getPartialCharacter

        private java.awt.Image getPartialCharacter()
        When the character is standing on a door, he is replaced with a red dot, provided by this method.
        Returns:
        A red oval used to display the character on a door.

      • getItemSetImage

        public java.awt.Image getItemSetImage()
        Allows the image of the currently equipped items to be visible.
        Returns:
        An image containing the currently equipped weapon and shield.

      • getItemInventory

        public java.awt.Image getItemInventory()
        Allows the image of the items currently in the inventory to be visible.
        Returns:
        An image containing all unequipped items.

      • getGemInventory

        public java.awt.Image getGemInventory()
        Allows the image of the currently available gems to be visible.
        Returns:
        An image containing the unequipped gems.

      • getSpellInventory

        public java.awt.Image getSpellInventory()
        Allows the image of the currently available spells to be visible.
        Returns:
        An image containing the unused spells.

      • getItemDescription

        public java.awt.Image getItemDescription(int pos)
        Creates a box presenting information about the item currently being scrolled-over.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the item being scrolled over.
        Returns:
        An image of a box with information about the item.

        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the gem being hovered over.
        Returns:
        The value of the gem being hovered over.

      • unequipItem

        public void unequipItem(boolean weapon)
        Moves the equipped item into the inventory.
        Parameters:
        weapon - true if weapon was selected, false if shield was selected.

        public void setGem(int pos)
        Equips the gem at pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the gem being equipped.

      • swapSpells

        Swaps the spell at pos with the last one.

        pos - the position of the spell being swapped with the last one.

        public void useSpell(int pos)

      • getBattleLength

        public int getBattleLength()
        Returns:
        How long a battle should take place based on the defense of the equipped shield and gem.

      • initiateBattle

        Initializes all variables related to a regular battle.

      • initiateBossBattle

        public void initiateBossBattle()
        Initializes all variables related to a boss battle.

      • endBattle

        public boolean endBattle()
        This method is used at the end of a battle to see if the player survived the battle. It increments points by all uneccessary damage.
        Returns:
        True if player won the battle, false if the player lost.

      • calculateDamage

        private int calculateDamage()
        This method calculates the amount of damage the player had dealt so far.
        Returns:
        Damage dealt by the player in the current battle.

      • awardItem

        public void awardItem()
        Gives the player an item, unless there are no items left in this level.

      • awardKey

        public void awardKey()
        Gives the player a key, or a gem, or a spell. The gem is only available on level 2 and 3, and the spell is only available on level 3.

      • awardGem

        public void awardGem()
        Gives the player a gem.

      • awardSpell

        public void awardSpell()
        Gives the player a spell.

      • getEnemy

        public java.awt.Image getEnemy()
        Returns:
        An image of the current foe, with the name of the foe, and the word to fight against.

      • getCurWord

        public java.lang.String getCurWord()
        Returns:
        The word the user is currently inputing.

      • incrementCurWord

        public boolean incrementCurWord(char letter)
        This method controls addition of letters to the end of the current word.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter that the user is attempting to add.
        Returns:
        Whether the letter was successfully added.

      • finalizeCurWord

        public void finalizeCurWord()
        Allows the user to add the current word to damaging words, and start a new word.

      • clearCurWord

        public void clearCurWord()
        Clears the current word, allowing the user to start on a new word.

        public int getAvailable(char which)

        second - the second String.
